content:
Yes, there are several interesting facts about the making of "Another One Bites the Dust"! 

- The song was released in 1980 and was written by Queen's bassist, John Deacon.
- The famous bassline that drives the song was created by Deacon and was reportedly inspired by the Chic song, "Good Times."
- The song was not originally intended to be a single, but after it became a big hit on the radio, the band decided to release it as a single.
- "Another One Bites the Dust" was Queen's second number one hit in the United States and was a major crossover hit in the R&B and disco charts.
- The song features Freddie Mercury on lead vocals and he also contributes falsetto backing vocals throughout the track.
- The distinctive sound effects in the intro and throughout the song were created by the band hitting metal chains against a metal bucket.
- The song has been famously sampled and interpolated in a number of other songs, including MC Hammer's "U Can't Touch This" and Michael Jackson's "Bad."
- "Another One Bites the Dust" is one of Queen's most popular and enduring hits, and is often cited as a classic example of the band's ability to create catchy, danceable rock songs.
